Our first lesson will introduce the course to you and get you started using R. If you've used R before, some of this may be review. But I bet everyone learns something new!

## Learning objectives

* Install R and RStudio on your local computer
* Learn how to install, uninstall, load, and unload packages
* Understand the tidyverse philosophy
* Build a mental model of R
* Code in the console

## Pre-meeting: Getting started

To prepare for the course, please do the following:

* View presentation on [Getting Started with R](https://canvas.unl.edu/courses/149637/files/folder/presentations?preview=14236447){target='_blank'} (17 min; [slides](../../slides/00_getting_started.qmd){target='_blank'})
* Install R from [https://r-project.org](https://cloud.r-project.org/){target='_blank'}
* Install RStudio from [Posit](https://posit.co/downloads/){target='_blank'}
* Install `{tidyverse}` package
* If you have any trouble installing these, contact me.
* Read the [syllabus](../../syllabus.html)
* Complete [course introduction form](https://canvas.unl.edu/courses/149637/pages/course-resources){target='_blank'}
* Read [SIDS 1](https://moderndive.netlify.app/1-getting-started.html){target='_blank'}, [Wickham 2020](https://tidyverse.tidyverse.org/articles/manifesto.html){target='_blank'}
